intro: Sorocea dentata, commonly known as the toothed sorocea, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its serrated leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in the spring. Sorocea dentata typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in partial to full sunlight. It is sometimes cultivated for its ornamental value due to its attractive foliage and blooms.
